values.description:
This pull request allows a subscriber to receive discovery information without setting `IGN_IP` even if it has multiple network interfaces. Let's explain this feature with an example using the current discovery and the new discovery:

Example: Let's imagine that you have your laptop connected to the wired OSRF LAN running the publisher example. You'll have to type something like this to start the publisher:

`$ IGN_PARTITION=caguero IGN_IP=172.23.1.81 ./publisher`

I set `IGN_IP` because I have another interface on my laptop (for the wireless connection).

Now, I want to run the subscriber example on my desktop machine that has two wired connections. One connection is shared with my laptop but the other uses a different subnet (I'm using our AT&T socket and the second network card).

* Using the current discovery I'll have to run the subscriber using:

`$ IGN_PARTITION=caguero IGN_IP=172.23.2.37 ./subscriber`

If you don't use `IGN_IP`, the kernel is choosing the interface for receiving discovery information, so it might choose the wrong one and we wouldn't receive the messages.

* Using the "new" discovery I can omit the `IGN_IP` in the subscriber because the discovery information is sent over all the interfaces.

`$ IGN_PARTITION=caguero ./subscriber`

CI results:

* [drone.io](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/467) is happy.
* [Jenkins Trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-trusty-amd64/31/) is happy.
* [Jenkins Utopic](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-utopic-amd64/6/) is happy.
* [Jenkins HomeBrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/58/) is happy.
* [Jenkins Windows](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-amd64/41/console) is happy (the code compiles, we still cannot run tests on Windows).
values.title: Send discovery information through all the network interfaces

values.description:
See this [issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/haptix-comm/issue/10/matlab-crashes-on-exit).

The workaround consists on creating the ZMQ context as a raw pointer, create the object in the constructor but don't destroy it in the destructor. This will leak some memory that should be handled by the OS but it doesn't cause MATLAB to hang anymore.

This pull request also:

* Fix some crashs on Windows while waiting for sockets to terminate.
*  fixes the compilation of the examples on Windows.
* Add the ZeroMQ DLLs to the examples build folder.

Thanks to @gerkey for starting this fix.
values.title: Workaround for avoiding a hang while using MATLAB

See this [issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/haptix-comm/issue/10/matlab-crashes-on-exit).

The workaround consists on creating the ZMQ context as a raw pointer, create the object in the constructor but don't destroy it in the destructor. This will leak some memory that should be handled by the OS but it doesn't cause MATLAB to hang anymore.

This pull request also:

* Fix some crashs on Windows while waiting for sockets to terminate.
*  fixes the compilation of the examples on Windows.
* Add the ZeroMQ DLLs to the examples build folder.

Thanks to @gerkey for starting this fix.
summary.html:
See this issue.

The workaround consists on creating the ZMQ context as a raw pointer, create the object in the constructor but don't destroy it in the destructor. This will leak some memory that should be handled by the OS but it doesn't cause MATLAB to hang anymore.

This pull request also:

  • Fix some crashs on Windows while waiting for sockets to terminate.
  • fixes the compilation of the examples on Windows.
  • Add the ZeroMQ DLLs to the examples build folder.

Thanks to @gerkey for starting this fix.

values.description:
See issue #32.

Now, the test creates random UUIDs, as well as topic/service names. All the callbacks that do not match the expected UUID or topic/service name are ignored because might be triggered by other nodes present on the same LAN.

It also contains a fix for a potential deadlock.

CI results:

 * [drone.io](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/526) is happy.
 * [Jenkins Trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-trusty-amd64/47/) is happy.
 * [Jenkins Utopic](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-utopic-amd64/19/) is happy.
 * [Jenkins HomeBrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/72/) is happy.
 * [Jenkins Windows](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-amd64/71/console) has some unrelated problem.

values.description:
`Node::Advertise()`, `Node::Subscribe()` and `Node::Request()` require a function callback. The suported function callbacks are free functions and member functions. This pull request removes the code duplication between the two versions of `Node::Advertise()`, `Node::Subscribe()` and `Node::Request()`.

It also includes a `void*` casting when populating the array of zmq::pollitem_t for zmq4.1.x compatibility (used in Mac OS X).

Thanks to @dirk-thomas for his help in this pull request.

values.description:
* Allow multiple major versions of the library installed side by side.
* Optional version when doing `find_package`

All the projects that depend on ignition-transport should replace the way they search for this dependency.

Before:


```
#!c++
find_package(ignition-transport QUIET REQUIRED)
if (NOT ignition-transport_FOUND)
  BUILD_ERROR ("Missing: Ignition Transport (libignition-transport-dev)")
endif()
set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_CXX_FLAGS}")
include_directories(${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_INCLUDE_DIRS})
link_directories(${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_LIBRARY_DIRS})
```

After:


```
#!c++

find_package(ignition-transport0 0.8.0 QUIET REQUIRED)
if (NOT ignition-transport0_FOUND)
  BUILD_ERROR ("Missing: Ignition Transport (libignition-transport0-dev)")
endif()
set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_CXX_FLAGS}")
include_directories(${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_INCLUDE_DIRS})
link_directories(${IGNITION-TRANSPORT_LIBRARY_DIRS})
```

CI results:

* [Ubuntu trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-trusty-amd64/30/) happy.
* [Mac OS X](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/39/) happy.
* [Windows](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-amd64/56/) happy.

values.description:
This is essentially reverting the changes that I made in pull request #84.

I didn't realize the following scenario:

1. Node1 advertises a topic and publishes a message periodically.
1. Node2 subscribes to the topic advertised by node1.
1. If node2 doesn't send hearbeats, after some time, node1 will interpret that the subscriber node2 is gone. If there are no other remote subscribers, node1 won't serialize or publish anything. This is wrong because node2 was still alive (but quiet).

So, all the nodes need to send heartbeats even if they're not advertising topics or services.

CI results:

* [Ubuntu trusty pending](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-trusty-amd64/40/).
* [Mac OS X happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/54/).
* [Windows happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-amd64/68/).


Priority increased in preparation for the upcoming releases.
values.title: Send heartbeats even if nodes are not advertising messages

summary.html:
This is essentially reverting the changes that I made in pull request #84.

I didn't realize the following scenario:

  1. Node1 advertises a topic and publishes a message periodically.
  2. Node2 subscribes to the topic advertised by node1.
  3. If node2 doesn't send hearbeats, after some time, node1 will interpret that the subscriber node2 is gone. If there are no other remote subscribers, node1 won't serialize or publish anything. This is wrong because node2 was still alive (but quiet).

So, all the nodes need to send heartbeats even if they're not advertising topics or services.

CI results:

  • Ubuntu trusty pending.
  • Mac OS X happy.
  • Windows happy.

Priority increased in preparation for the upcoming releases.

values.description:
Unless you change the partition name with the environment variable `IGN_PARTITION`, the default partition name is no longer the empty string. Now, it's a combination of hostname and username. values.description:
This is an API change to make the user callbacks look like:


```
#!c++

void cb(const example::msgs::StringMsg &_msg)
```

instead of:


```
#!c++

void cb(const std::string &_topic, const example::msgs::StringMsg &_msg)
```


The motivation for this change is that most of the times the user does not need to know the topic name because callbacks are usually not shared between different topics or services. If this is the case, the user can include the topic name inside the message definition.

After merging this pull request, we'll have to update HAPTIX.

CI results:

* [Trusty is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/25/).
* [Homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/20/).
* [Windows is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/55/).

values.description:
This is another API change. It affects the way a Node is created. Now, a node will only accept one optional parameter of type `NodeOptions` that contains all options to be applied to your node. For now, the only options allowed are the ability to change the default namespace and partition name. 

This change will allow to extend the number of options in the future without breaking the API.

* [Trusty is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/28/).

values.description:
This is another API change. It affects the way a topic/service is advertised. Now, `Advertise()` will only accept the topic/service name and one optional parameter of type `AdvertiseOptions` that contains all options to be applied to this particular topic/service. For now, the only option allowed is the ability to change the default scope. 

This change will allow to extend the number of options in the future without breaking the API.

CI results:

* [Trusty is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/30/).

values.description:
And one more API change. This time affects the way we advertise messages. Now, we have to specify the message type that we'll publish associated with the topic that we're advertising. E.g.:

```
#!c++

node.Advertise<example::msgs::StringMsg>("/foo");
```

In addition, this pull request adds the following checks:

* When a message is published on a given topic, it checks that the message type matches the type advertised during the advertising phase.
* Before delivering a message to a callback, it checks that the type of the incoming message and the type of the expected message in the callback match.
* When a service call is requested, it checks that there's a service provider offering the requested service with the same parameter types as the ones included in the request (synchronous version) or the ones specified in the callback (asynchronous version).

CI results:

* [Trusty is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/33/).
* [Homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/28/).
* [Windows is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/69/).
